cons: Salary, education reimbursment, great place to work

pros: Small hospital, family based , nice people
cons: The pay is less than average and no weekend differential pay

pros: Everything is good here I like the work ethics and environment is good here
cons: Small hospital, low pay compare to other hospitals

pros: Free gifts, good health and dental insurance, good benefits

pros: flexible schedule, family-feel work environment
cons: pay could be better, understaffed often

pros: Had a new grad program available for different departments, the educator for the program was amazing. Good place for starting experience

Pay is low compared to other places, benefits are not the best, lots of turn around, short staffed often.

pros: Training is good and education is good.
cons: Nurses speaking in Tagalog while working and Human Resources allows it.

pros: Nice staff, easy charting system. The midshift was too hard for me- a constant 12 hours but I hear that all midshifts are like that. I had to leave because it was too taxing on my body.
cons: The midshift was too hard for me- a constant 12 hours but I hear that all midshifts are like that. I had to leave because it was too taxing on my body.

pros: good USC benefits, nice rx managers, things are relaxed, not crazy busy.
cons: lots of drama and different personalities in pharmacy with no repercussions , nurses are a bit spoiled, no tube system, lots of clinical monitoring paper work vs electronic.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Well organized, slow pace, small unit, low acuity
cons: Micromanagement, a little Catty, Cerner

job_title: RN, BSN, CCRN in Glendale, CA

job_title: Past Management in Los Angeles, CA
pros: not many.. wish I could name a few but since the new USC buy out.. all the family atmosphere vanished and is now just another corporate facility.. too bad..
cons:
management is pure corporate.. no feeling of teamwork at all ..
Consultants run amuck at the moment.. throwing directors, managers and employees under the bus to quantify their highly paid fee's..

pros: Leadership really cares about its employees.  Visible leadership.  They round on our floors weekly to ask how we are doing seeking input! Daily tiered huddles for 15 minutes in the morning keeps everyone informed.  The "culture" is one that makes me excited to come to work every day.  Proud to say I work here.
cons: None that I'm aware of....

review_title: Solid starter for someone new to the health field and looking to break in
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
*Its a great place to start with no experience in the health field
*A solid Management staff that improves with time
*Willing to work with your schedule
*The position asks a lot but you gain a ton of different areas of experience to strengthen a resume
cons: *ER is a drama filled nightmare

review_title: Great part time job while a student
pros: Fun co workers in different departments here and there, quiet on weekends and yummy food to choose from in the cafeteria
cons: Micro management from the department I worked in. Like most places, understaffed and no over time was allowed unless it was too late

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Glendale, CA
pros: The pro of this company was the individuals who worked there. Everyone was very friendly, outgoing and helpful, it makes you feel really at home, however this was also before Verdugo Hills Hospital became part of USC.
cons: Compensation may not be the best, however benefits were gear on providing employees with health preventions.

job_title: Project Coordinator in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: This was a great local place to work.  It had a small town feel and you knew everybody you worked with.
cons: Management many times promoted on friendship rather than ability. When USC took over it lost much of the appeal to work there

review_title: A truly positive place to work!
job_title: Quality Data Manager in Glendale, CA
pros: Engaged leadership, clinicians and staff who are all about the community
cons: Rate of change has been high.   Surviving, let alone being profitable in healthcare has been a challenge

pros: Strong leadership, Just culture, leaders truly care about employees.  A miraculous place to work
cons: Poor support from hospital system,  older facility.

pros: everyone was willing to help me learn as a new grad rn
cons: small hospital with low census, so we were called off often

pros: What a great place to work.
